thread.title: Bengals injury report: Iloka, Gilberry questionable

title: Bengals injury report: Iloka, Gilberry questionable
text:
Bengals injury report: Iloka, Gilberry questionable 
Updated: Fri, Oct 09 2015, 01:36 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- Starting safety George Iloka and key reserve defensive lineman Wallace Gilberry are both listed as questionable on the Bengals official NFL injury report for Sunday's game against the Seattle Seahawks. 
The game is being held in Paul Brown Stadium at 1 p.m. 
Iloka missed last Sunday's game against Kansas City with a lingering ankle injury that forced him out of the previous Sunday's game in Baltimore in the second half. He was a limited participant in practice on Friday after also being limited on Wednesday and Thursday. Iloka said on Wednesday he expects to play against Seattle, "barring a setback," and the fact that he was at least a limited participant in practice all three days is a sign he will probably play against the Seahawks. 
Shawn Williams played 63 of 75 defensive snaps in place of Iloka against Kansas City. 
Gilberry is battling a calf injury and was a limited participant in Friday's practice after not practicing on Wednesday or Thursday. That's probably a good sign that he will be able to play against Seattle. 
Three other players are listed as probable: running back Jeremy Hill, cornerback Adam Jones and safety Reggie Nelson. All three were full participants in Friday's practice. 
Jones is dealing with a groin injury and didn't practice on Wednesday and was limited on Thursday. 
Hill has a knee injury that led to him being a limited participant on Wednesday and Thursday. 
Nelson has a hamstring injury that had him as a limited participant on Wednesday, but he was back to being a full participant on Thursday. 
The Seahawks injury report will be announced later this afternoon. 
Jeremy Hill photo: Tony Tribble for Local 12
